meanings.definition: Not characteristic of a pastor or pastoral setting.
meanings.sent1: The city's bustling streets were unpastoral compared to the peaceful countryside.
meanings.sent2: The loud construction noises were unpastoral in the serene village.
meanings.sent3: The unpastoral cityscape made the sheep visiting from the countryside feel out of place.
meanings.sent4: Her modern art exhibit was an unpastoral twist on traditional pastoral scenes.
meanings.sent5: The unpastoral landscape was devoid of any greenery, resembling a concrete jungle.

meanings.definition: Not suitable for or typical of a pastoral environment.
meanings.sent1: The unpastoral music blaring from the speakers disrupted the peaceful picnic.
meanings.sent2: The bright neon lights were unpastoral in the quiet village at night.
meanings.sent3: The unpastoral graffiti on the barn wall added a touch of urban flair to the farm.
meanings.sent4: The unpastoral storm clouds gathered ominously over the usually tranquil meadow.
meanings.sent5: The unpastoral smell of exhaust fumes filled the air, overpowering the usual scent of flowers.
